intro: Pasania eyrei, commonly known as the velvetleaf or pasania, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including India and Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Pasania eyrei is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and floral display.
